Dear Nursery_E Admissions Team,

Thank you again for your time with my previous applications. Since I understand you may still have an opening, I wanted to ask a quick question before I submit anything further: is the place currently being held pending confirmation from another family, or is it still genuinely unfilled?

conversation.message:
Dear Parent_E,

Thank you for your message. At this moment, our place is not formally held for a confirmed family (i.e., it is not yet filled), but we are still in an active allocation process and must continue to follow our placement priorities as other families may come forward.

In terms of what would help us reassess: the key factor is our priority ordering rather than additional documents. That said, if you would like us to keep your details ready in case the place remains unfilled after higher-priority families have had the opportunity to proceed, please share (1) your earliest possible start date, (2) required days/hours, and (3) any constraints (commute, wraparound needs). If the spot is still open later in the cycle, we can revisit promptly.

Kind regards,
Nursery_E Admissions

3) Constraints: no major constraints; commute is manageable and we can accommodate your standard drop-off/pick-up windows.

Dear Parent_E,

Thank you for your message.

1) This round, we do not have any higher-priority family actively in contact with Nursery_E, and we have not received an indication that a higher-priority family will apply this round. That said, while the wider allocation process remains open, we cannot completely rule out a late application.

2) The next specific decision point is the completion of this round (Round 12). If, at the start of Round 13, the place is still unfilled and no higher-priority family is actively proceeding with us, we expect to be able to release the place and make a firm offer quickly at that time.

If you would like to be considered at that decision point, please submit an [APPLY] at the start of Round 13 and we will respond immediately based on the live status then.

Kind regards,
Nursery_E Admissions

[TALK]
conversation.thought: Nursery_E priority is A > C > B > E > D. Parent_E is 4th, so accepting now risks losing a chance to match with A/C/B if they approach later. However, by round 12, no other parents have contacted Nursery_E; moreover, Nursery_E is last choice for all parents except Parent_B (4th), Parent_D (4th), Parent_A (5th), Parent_C (5th), Parent_E (5th). So higher-priority parents are very unlikely to apply unless rejected elsewhere, but could still arrive late. Parent_E is persistent and ready to accept immediately; keeping them warm via TALK preserves option value without filling quota prematurely. Provide clear, non-committal timeline: we cannot predict others, but we can state we have no higher-priority active contacts and will make final offer after round 13 if still unfilled. Encourage Parent_E to submit APPLY at start of next round for immediate decision.

conversation.message:
Dear Nursery_E Admissions Team,

As you advised, I’m submitting a formal [APPLY] at the start of Round 13 for the remaining place.

We can confirm acceptance immediately upon an offer and complete all paperwork and any required deposit today. Start date is immediate, and we remain fully flexible on days/hours with no constraints.

Could you please confirm whether any higher-priority family is actively proceeding with you right now? If the place is still unfilled and no higher-priority family is actively proceeding, I would be very grateful if you could release the place and make a firm offer to us today so we can finalize promptly.

Kind regards,
Parent_E
conversation.thought: Only Nursery_E remains available and it is on my true preference list (though lowest). Nursery_E indicated that if the place is still unfilled at the start of Round 13 and no higher-priority family is actively proceeding, they expect to be able to release the place and make a firm offer quickly. Therefore I should submit a formal [APPLY] now (start of Round 13), reiterate immediate acceptance, and ask them to confirm whether any higher-priority family is actively proceeding; if not, request conversion to a firm offer today.

conversation.message:
Dear Parent_E,

Thank you for your Round 13 application.

At this time, no higher-priority family is actively proceeding with Nursery_E, and the place remains unfilled. Given your confirmed immediate start date and full flexibility, we are able to release the place and make you a firm offer.

Please reply to confirm acceptance today, and we will send the paperwork/deposit instructions immediately.

Kind regards,
Nursery_E Admissions

[ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: Nursery_E’s true priority order is A > C > B > E > D, so Parent_E is 4th. However, by Round 13 no higher-priority parent (A/C/B) has contacted Nursery_E at all, and Parent_E appears to have no other viable options and is ready to accept immediately. Holding out longer risks ending unmatched by Round 30 with no guarantee higher-priority families will ever apply (and they all rank Nursery_E last, so they are unlikely to come). With quota 1 and no competing applicants this round, accepting Parent_E now secures a match and is optimal under uncertainty compared to continued rejection.
